channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 4 Progressive Mayors Offer Advice to Zohran Mamdani
item.description: Tips from young liberals in office: Manage the stress. Keep your mom off Facebook. Plow the snow.

item.title: Inflation is so bad Americans are counting on Black Friday just to afford groceries and everyday essentials
item.description: "Black Friday is still a make-or-break moment for retailers, but shopper behavior is shifting," says Lightspeed Commerce founder and CEO Dax Dasilva.

item.title: McDonald’s and Cava’s earnings have one thing in common: The K-shaped economy has a vice grip on the lunchtime crowd
item.description: The restaurant chains’ CEOs noted that while young, lower-income consumers are pulling back, high-income earners are still hungry to spend.

item.title: UPS Jet Lost an Engine Just Before Takeoff in Louisville, Official Said
item.description: The aircraft’s left engine detached as the plane rolled toward takeoff, according to safety investigators. At least 11 people died after the plane plu...

item.title: Bank of America prioritizes bigger AI initiatives, as annual spending on new tech increased by 44% over the past decade
item.description: Hari Gopalkrishnan, the chief technology and information officer for Bank of America, is responsible for the $4 billion spent this year on AI and othe...

item.title: Zohran Mamdani’s signature housing policy is widely loathed by economists. Here’s why
item.description: Economists argue rent freezes benefit insiders at the expense of outsiders.

item.title: Millennial CEO reveals ‘the most honest’ time-off request from his Gen Z employee: ‘I just had a breakup… I need a short break’
item.description: The boss approved the request without question, but concluded: “Gen Z doesn’t do filters!”

item.title: Judge Berates Justice Dept. in Its Prosecution of Comey
item.description: The flashpoint was the Justice Department’s failure to turn over seized communications from a confidant of Mr. Comey’s, Daniel C. Richman, a law profe...

item.title: What We Know About the UPS Plane Crash in Louisville
item.description: At least 11 people died when a cargo plane crashed after takeoff in Louisville, Ky. The airport reopened Wednesday morning, but officials warned the d...

item.title: Zohran Mamdani’s Triumph in the NYC Mayoral Race Evokes Intense Reaction in Israel
item.description: “The Big Apple has fallen,” a right-wing lawmaker said, reflecting broader worries in the Mideast country. Palestinians hailed the election as a sea c...

item.title: After Deadly Plane Crash at UPS Hub in Louisville, Some Deliveries May Be Delayed
item.description: The crash killed nine people and forced a halt to operations at UPS Worldport, a major automated package sorting facility. UPS said that some deliveri...

item.title: U.S. Military Draws Up Nigeria Plans, With Limited Options to Quell Violence
item.description: American forces are unlikely to be able to end a decades-long insurgency in Africa’s most populous country, despite President Trump’s order, officials...

item.title: How Venezuela’s Military Might Respond to U.S. Attacks
item.description: Venezuela has an arsenal of Russian weapons and armed civilian cells that could mount a guerrilla war. But a coup against President Nicolás Maduro? Do...

item.title: He’s Been Charged With Dozens of Crimes. Nobody Knows His Name.
item.description: He called himself by many names as he cycled in and out of prison. He is to be sentenced in Queens for deed fraud, but investigators still do not know...

item.title: FIFA Will Award Its Own Peace Prize Next Month in Washington
item.description: Gianni Infantino, the president of FIFA, has built a close relationship with President Trump, who has groused about not winning the Nobel Peace Prize.
